page.title: 09ST JOHN'S SCHOOL.
page.content: As part of the Domesday Survey we visited the largest junior school in our area; St John's. This is a Church of England aided school in Penistone itself. We asked the Headmaster Mr Whitfield some questions. There are about 200 pupils in the school and the are about equally split between boys and girls. The pupils on the whole are well behaved. The schoo; meals are popular and are subsidised. The breakes are long enough. A few children travel by bus to the school but most walk. The school was opened in 1968 when it moved from its old site next to the church. The old school was opened in 1868.
